abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Health System
            Reconstruction Project is to help Liberia recover from the
            damage done to the health sector during the years of civil
            war. Negative impacts include: visual impact following the
            disposal of construction and demolition waste onto
            roadsides, employee or community exposed to high noise
            level, air pollution from burning of demolition waste e.g.
            wood, paper etc, increased soil erosion due to vegetation
            clearing, soil trampling and compaction, and contamination
            risk by HIV from the labor force. Mitigation measures
            include: 1) regular collection and evacuation of work site
            refuse towards authorized dumps; 2) schedule work periods to
            avoid peak hospital hours; 3) appropriate containment
            measures for all operational areas and proper disposal of
            used lubricants; 4) soil erosion control measures; 5)
            regular collection of work sites wastes for proper disposal;
            6) liquid waste discharged at designated outfalls after
            effluent treatment to  protect water resources; 7) quick
            sorting, collection and disposal of waste removed from the
            sites in accordance with applicable regulations; and 8)
            conduct an awareness raising campaign for the work sites
            staff and the users of hospital infrastructure.
